result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Ryan Hastings was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions of Probation on Counts 3 and 4:
Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the department; obey all rules and regulations of the department. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 
Restitution to be paid to victims - parties have 30 days to stipulate.
Anger management counseling or any counseling that is ordered by probation.
AODA/ Driver Safety plan.
Court waives court costs.

3:04 PM Defendant Matthew Ryan Hastings appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Matthew Ryan Hastings.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt states that there is a joint recommendation for 22CF32; count 1 for 3 years probation and 22CF53; count 1 for a 6 month jail sentence. Count 2 and 3 will be DRI. Court colloquy. MH enters a guilty plea on 22CF53. 

22CF32 - MH doesn't object to revoking the diversion agreement. Court will revoke the DPA. Attorney Forehand asks for probation in this case.

Attorney Bartelt comments about the joint agreement on both cases. 

22CF32; Count 1: 
Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 3 years.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Costs waived.

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Sign up for probation today

22CF53; Court orders:
6 months in the Richland County Jail with huber; to begin on 09/07/22.
Defendant may serve the 6 month in the Juneau County Jail; if they accept him.
Credit of 22 days credit.
Pay costs.

Count 2 and 3- DRI
Motion hearing on September 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
